types.html:
tuyé

  1. (regional) A pyramidal smokehouse chimney, commonly found in farmhouses on the French-Swiss border.
    • (Can we date this quote?), “Maison d'hôtes Doubs - Ferme à tuyé”, in L’arbre à Chapeaux‎[1]:
      Autrefois foyer, âtre chaud où se tenir, cuisine et fumoir pour la conservation de la viande, le tuyé accueillait la veillée.
      Formerly a home, a warm hearth to sit in, a kitchen, & a smokehouse for the preservation of meat, the tuyé used to accommodate evening gatherings.
trans: A pyramidal smokehouse chimney, commonly found in farmhouses on the French-Swiss border.

title: tuyé
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /tɥe/
